Technique: FORMED BY HAND; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Figurine of bewitchment
Description: This figurine of bewitchment, modelled in raw clay, depicts a kneeling captive, the cords tied at the back. It is decorated with a hieratic text, written in very cursive signs painted in black. The example, which is in a good state of preservation, is part of the large collection of similar figurines found in the necropolis of Saqqara. The objects served to obtain a certain magical power over all sorts of enemies.
